name: Stovetop Pesto Tortelloni with Cherry Tomatoes and Spinach
description: Tender cheese-filled tortelloni tossed in pesto with sweet cherry tomatoes and wilted spinach. Mild, quick, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes.
If needed, grate the parmesan cheese.
Open the pesto and have it ready.
If the spinach leaves are large, roughly chop them.
cook_steps: Boil the tortelloni until just tender (check pack timing, usually 3–4 minutes). Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook 2–3 minutes until they start to soften.
Add spinach and cook 1–2 minutes until wilted.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in pesto and a splash of reserved pasta water to loosen.
Add drained tortelloni and toss gently to coat, adding more pasta water as needed for a silky sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with parmesan cheese and serve.
